website_summaries.verdict: You may want to invest in the Iron Rangers, one of Red Wing's most popular styles, if you need durable work boots. But other options on our list are more practical for other occasions and less pricey.
pros: Ideal for men who need a well-made pair of boots for work thanks to the comfortable fit, rugged soles, and precisely crafted leather
They also look good with jeans and other casual trousers
cons: On the higher end of the price range
They run around a half size large, but this is typical of the brand
At least a few defective pairs have been reported

customer_reviews.title: Go to a Redwing Store!!!
customer_reviews.text: ****NEWS FLASH****. There is actually a place you can go and try these boots on first and make sure you have the right size! It’s called a “store”. There are nice people there that will help you too. It’s amazing. Seriously thought, I told the guy I was a 10 1/2 and he brought me 9 1/2 without telling me. He talked me through how they should fit now and how they will fit after a few weeks of wear. Please support the dwindling number of retailers out there. It was the SAME price as it is on amazon and they actually fit. Great boots by the way, but that is old news to anyone reading this. :).
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome boots! I got worried after I placed the order and I read a review that said the boot sizes tend to run somewhat bigger than advertised. I'm a 10.5 but when I tried them on they fit perfectly. I wore them to work the next day which can get rather physical but by the end of the day my feet didn't hurt which can happen when you're breaking in new boots. I love my Iron Rangers!
customer_reviews.author: Juan Felipe

customer_reviews.title: I’m not a hipster
customer_reviews.text: These Iron Rangers fit perfectly. Are they perfectly comfortable out of the box as they will be in a year? No. But I’m not some pansy hipster with a hair bun and a perfectly straight beard that complains about unbroken in leather and my soy decaf latte being a couple degrees off. Point is for $300 your buying a dependable hardworking boot that will last a lifetime. Quite unlike the person who still lives in their mommy’s basement getting triggered by my comments.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Horrible - don't understand the reviews!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son last summer and they didn't last a month. Returned and received a refund. When talking to customer service, they told me these boots aren't working boots but more for leisure, dress. They need to update their product description and definitely take the word 'Iron' out of the title. Would not purchase again nor recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chilli

customer_reviews.title: Sorely disappointed and not sure if they are legit.
customer_reviews.text: When you order something expensive you do not expect it to show up ina generic box looking nothing like it is supposed to. These showed up in a generic brown box and look nothing like the pictures of what copper should look like color-wise. I cannot remember the last time I bought an expensive television or phone and the salesperson brought it out in a generic brown box, it looked nothing like it was supposed to, and I handed over my cash and walked out with it. And to add insult to injury, each shoe had long black hairs in it.
customer_reviews.author: jc

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Not Gloves
customer_reviews.text: After unboxing my new Redwing Iron Rangers, I quickly strapped these bad boys onto my hands and went out on the town. I immediately found them to be very uncomfortable and a utter hinderance to my finger dexterity. Only by gripping items in the crook of my elbow and pressing them against my chest was I able to lift items more than a foot off the ground. I considered returning them but, upon tripping over a discarded thesaurus, my feet slipped into these Iron Rangers like a lover welcoming a young man home from war. I have decided to keep them as I have discovered their use as footwear. I highly recommend. Size down you ingrates.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Long beard longed for Iron Rangers
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of iron rangers and the pair I prefer. I knew what to expect in fit and comfort and ordered a full size below my normal knowing they would be amazing within a few hours of wearing. My first pair is "rough and tough", which although a beautiful color, shoes every scuff and scratch as part of its "charm". I believe I prefer the durability and elegance of the black leather. These things make me feel like a badass and I know they will look and feel great for years.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Solid Quality Boot from a good company
customer_reviews.text: This boot mimics the the old army Corcoran Jump boot, though I never see anyone make the same reference. With its cap toe the silhouette is very similar. I am a size 10 sneaker, but am a 9 1/2 in this boot. It felt a bit snug at first, but the leather stretches. The Vibram outsole is semi-lugged and grips well to the ground. The boot is a very dark Hershey bar brown and has a oiled finish to the leather. This is the best color of the selection. When laced up this boot feels very supportive. You can’t go wrong with this boot.
customer_reviews.author: Dan, PA

customer_reviews.title: Great boots! Bet you will love them too!
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of these in the lighter Hawthorne and loved them. I wanted a darker, more traditional leather, so I sold those and got this color. I wear a 12 in all other shoes and boots, but 10.5 in these, so keep that in mind when ordering. Odd on their sizing. The boots are a tad heavy and very stiff before you break them in, but you will fall in love with them. Can’t wait to break these in.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Brantley

customer_reviews.title: buy a full size smaller than you wear in every ...
customer_reviews.text: buy a full size smaller than you wear in every other shoe. Also, these things must take a whole cow's worth of leather per boot to make because it's thick, heavy and there's a lot of it. They are tough and well built right down to the steel bridge cable they're stitched together with. They are defo badass boots and defo for badasses only. ...because if you're going to survive the break-in process you better not be a crybaby. It's going to hurt and it's going to take some time. ...but, once you get through it, they are astonishingly comfortable and wear like iron for a lifetime
customer_reviews.author: Don MarcosTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: New favorites
customer_reviews.text: I typically wear a 45.5 euro and went with a 10.5 in these and they are the right size. They were a hair loose but I put in a thin insole and now they are perfect and have just the right amount of toe room. They are very comfortable even out of the box. I don’t necessarily agree with getting the smallest ones you can fit in and trying to break them in. I like having a little toe room personally. Besides that yeah these are pretty much the best boots I’ve ever had and I’ve had quite a few. Yeah they’re expensive but I get lots of compliments on them and they seem well built.
customer_reviews.author: majortomiscominghome

customer_reviews.title: Quality leather craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.text: Still not fully broken in but these are the best boots I've ever worn. The stiff leather will take a week or 2 to form to your foot but once shaped, it's like a glove. Also note, this is sized as classic shoes, so size down between .5-1 full size from your sneakers This is a real shoe, not a Nike or Reebok, it will never have the features/feel of a sneaker. If you feet are delicate and you are of feeble constitution, you should keep looking. If you cannot commit to breaking in high quality leather for an almost custom fit, keep looking. This is a classic style with vintage features, a beautiful artisan clothing item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: A great looking pair of boots. They will definitely need to be broken in, but are still reasonably comfortable out of the box. The Construction seems to be very well done. It is nice to see the traditional shoemaking features, such as the stitched-on outer sole, rather than the more common Faux-stitching on less expensive boots. That being said, i am a little nervous that the tread (which is very thin) may leave the stitching on the bottom of the soles vulnerable to wearing out rather quickly if worn on hard surfaces. But only time will tell with that; and thanks to the construction i would be able to have them re-soled should that happen.
customer_reviews.author: jacob a brayton

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to size down
customer_reviews.text: After the first month of absolute torture breaking these in, they're the most comfortable shoes I own and I get compliments all the time. They aren't lined, so you don't have to worry about them being to hot even in warm weather. Size down a half size and be warned that the break in period is seriously painful, but once you get through it it's totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Wow first pair of IR
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 1/2 size down as recommended and they fit perfectly. This is my first time ordering expensive boots on-line and I am very impressed with these boots. The color is nice, the quality of built appears superior and they fit and look good. Not sure about durability, but from the reviews and my intended use I should have these for a long long time. Bought the Muleskinners too! Love these boots, Black Harness is next
customer_reviews.author: Kyong Tupper

customer_reviews.title: This is a man’s boot
customer_reviews.text: Ok, first, if you’re wondering about the size, yes, order a half size small. I had my foot measured by a redwing dealer ordered a size 12, but they were too big. 11.5...perfect! Second, everyone talks about a long break in. These are a man’s boot. They aren’t going to fit or feel like a tennis shoe. Been wearing mine two days straight. They feel great. Heavy duty leather, crafted to last. If you’re looking for style, look somewhere else. I repeat, this is a mans boot!
customer_reviews.author: Otterbox fan

customer_reviews.title: Expected a better quality boot.
customer_reviews.text: Parts of this boot I really liked, but it's not a +$300 product made by elves in the enchanted forests of bootland. My main beef is something really simple: the show laces are too short AND they are nothing but paracord that someone hacked off with a knife and touched the end on a hot plate. It looks sloppy. How hard would it have been to include a real set of shoelaces in a $300 pair of boots !
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Great boot.
customer_reviews.text: Great boot. The speed hooks make them easy to put on/off. Pretty comfortable right out of box, and after a few wears even more comfortable. The toe area is a nice size as well, I have a couple other boots with a more pointy toe and they are too tight. But then the square toed boots are very unfashionable, so this is a good fit but stylish too. The bottom tread is doing a good job preventing slipping in snowy condition.
customer_reviews.author: AlexLovesAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Find the proper size
customer_reviews.text: So I have owned a few of these boots. Sizing is everything with getting the proper fit and break in for these boots. I normally wear a size 12 in shoes but I sized for a 10.5 in my boots. Fit perfect with enough space for my toes to wiggle around the way I like them. Some might say the 10 size would be better but not for my feet. Every foot is different so I would suggest you try to find a local redwing store like I did in Jacksonville FL and the 10.5 fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Molon Labe .308

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Boot
customer_reviews.text: Great boot, I have only worn a few times but I am giving my review so soon because I don’t plan on doing a lot of wear and tear on them. Wanted to add that the color got the Charcoal color are presented a little lighter in the pictures in my opinion and look darker in person. Really like the feel and look of these boots. Red Wing can make some top of the line boots.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Pals

customer_reviews.title: Long break in.
customer_reviews.text: Great boots after wearing them for about 3 months I feel comfortable reviewing them. The iron rangers are a great solid boot. Very well made. That being said, they do take a good solid 1-2 weeks to break in. I wore them every day after work for shopping, running errands, ect. It took 2 weeks for me. After that they have gotten more comfortable with each wear. They are solid leather with no insulation so the do get cold. I've fixed this by simply buying thicker socks. I expect these to far out last the other boots that typically only last me a year before wearing out. I belive they were a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Lee M.

customer_reviews.title: By far the best boots I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I was wary about dropping $325 on a pair of boots, but after wearing these for several weeks I can that they're worth it. I'm a real estate appraiser, and on any given day can be in anything from a forested tract of land to a medical facility. I was worried about the traction on these boots since the soles looked relatively smooth, but they are great in mud, snow and do pretty well on ice. Bottom line, I would definitely buy these boots again. They're surprisingly comfortable and stable, and they look great.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: love this boot I had originally bought the women's version ...
customer_reviews.text: love this boot I had originally bought the women's version size 7B lengthwise is fine but the width is just two tight it has stretched somewhat but I have to where thinner socks so I bought men's 5D cuz it is a wide boot it was just a bit big in the heal but I had some inserts put them in and they are perfect I wish redwing made a wide in this boot for women. the quality is great awesome boot
customer_reviews.author: judy

customer_reviews.title: Very disapointed wth this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Left boot fits a little tight. Right boot is way too tight. I am trying to stretch them with boot fitter, which I purchased for another $51.00 just for these boot. So far they pop back to original after an hour of use. I wear an 11D shoe and work boots for 40 years, Amazon website suggested size 11D redwing size, but the worst thing is the right boot is much smaller than the left.
customer_reviews.author: BJT

customer_reviews.title: Even the mini lug soles wear out quickly!
customer_reviews.text: Best boots I've ever worn. This is my second pair. Glad they decided to use the mini lug so you don't have to spend the extra $100 getting then resoled at a RW dealer, however, this model could stand a heavier lug sole, at least as an option. Treat them well and they'll treat you just fine. Never had any issues after waterproofing them, but I use my own beeswax/ oil recipe. They have worked very well for me as an all around boot.
customer_reviews.author: Jack R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great product but misleading, product was not brand new.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, the quality is amazing. Totally worth the price. Unfortunately it seems that i got a pair that had previously been worn. After wearing for a few hours I realized the left boot felt tighter than the right. Upon further inspection, the left boot had an aftermarket insole in it. Meaning that they were worn previously. Great product but disappointed that I bought a product i thought was new but shows signs of previous use.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Bite the bullet and get em!
customer_reviews.text: Top 4 things to know before you buy. 1. Size- the 8085 run big. Order 1 size smaller then regular shoe size. (Check R.W store to be sure) 2. Color- find a leather color you like and understand the patina look that comes with time 3.Stiff- use a thick sock that goes past top part, ankle bending with thick leather can be expected (but definitely worth it) 4. Fun- enjoy your boots with everything you do. Love my boots, 2nd day in them( last pair was new 30 years ago to me) lots of complements , I would buy again I have the 8085 and 1178.
customer_reviews.author: Zoto3.E

customer_reviews.title: Boot scootin' great buy!
customer_reviews.text: They are designed to have room for your toes. If you don't want extra toe room, then order a half size down. They also give you a warm fuzzy feeling from supporting American workers, and farmers. They are taxpaying Americans just like us and we helped put food on their table and support a local economy!
customer_reviews.author: Highly Evolved

customer_reviews.title: Very hard on the inside of boot with no lining!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst boot I have ever worn and I mean ever. It made the top of my toes bleed on one foot and the boot is so hard I had to buy boot inserts to be able to work in them are just wear in the yard. I also had to put mole skin on the toe box on the inside because even with socks it wasn’t good it would rub top of my toes. I’ve worn all kinds of work boots this being the most money and the worst fit. I ‘be tried everything to get these things to soften up it has been bad from day one.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Footwear
customer_reviews.text: I typically wear a 13, I purchased 12 and am happy. They are sharp shoes. A little narrower than I would prefer but they are loosening up. After about 40hrs of on the foot time they are now comfortable. Wear proper socks, I use darn tough and have never developed any hot spots.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great Stylish work boot
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. I've had them for three months and I've been breaking them in slowly. I spend a lot of time on my feet and they haven't disappointed. I typically wear a 10 shoe but I'd seen the reviews about them being big. I got the 9.5 and they're still a little big. I can wear double socks or thick hiking socks and then they're perfect. If you're not going that route, definitely go a half size smaller than your foot at least.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Casual work to a night on the town, comfortable and sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Stiff but breaking in nicely.. I've had these for a few months now and they are becoming quite comfortable, even with only wearing them a couple of times a week. I wear them with khaki pants, jeans and even a gray suit once! I've received numerous compliments on the oxblood boots.
customer_reviews.author: Double D

customer_reviews.title: I look forward to when they get even more comfortable after their break in period
customer_reviews.text: These boots live up to the expectations. They are rugged yet can work in a business casual situation. Based on all the reviews I thought these boots would be really stiff on the first wear but I don’t think that was the case. I own 1000mile boots and other redwing boots so maybe I am just used to the feeling of leather boots. I look forward to when they get even more comfortable after their break in period. I wear a size 10 minimalist tennis shoe and I have a rather wide foot but I went with a size 9D and the fit was perfect, tight in all the right places with enough room for my toes to move around.
customer_reviews.author: jose palacio

customer_reviews.title: So cool. Quality. Can’t wait for the break in.
customer_reviews.text: Sizing was tough. I went to a redwing store because I knew getting the right fit would be tricky. “You measure at a 9.5 so here, try this 7.5” They were pretty tight, but they assured me the leather would stretch after break in, so I’d want snug now to avoid my foot sliding around later. When the 7.5’s showed up, I was almost positive they were not gonna work. Wore them around the house and noticed some stretching. After a couple days I can def tell they’re breaking in. I’d expect to be in a good spot after another 5-7 days. That being said...these boots are definitely cool. And the quality is evident. Expecting many miles outta my IR’s.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: After wanting a pair of Iron Rangers for a couple of years, I finally decided to pull the trigger via Amazon. Prices here were better than the Red Wing online store. I couldn’t be happier! I ordered them one half size down from what I normally wear in running shoes & dress shoes, and that was perfect for me. I’ve read that some people didn’t get an actual Red Wing box, but my pair came in a factory labeled Red Wing box as expected. There’s definitely a break-in period as the leather is pretty stiff at first...but hang in there, it’ll be worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Hawthorne

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The most I've ever spent on any sort of footwear but boy are they worth it! I've only worn them a couple of times but breaking them in hasn't been nearly as bad as I expected. I sized down a half size as is recommended with these boots and they fit perfectly and I only expected them to get more comfortable the more I break them in. Only gripe is that they didn't come in a redwing box but no big deal honestly.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Zamora-Romero

customer_reviews.title: True Pair of Boots
customer_reviews.text: A very well made boot. Its better to get fitted in an actual store. I've never followed the "go a size smaller for boots". Ive worn cowboy boots, hiking, work, casual, formal, combat, but these are the first pair of boots Ive had where I'd say it's best to go a half size smaller. Learned that the hard way, but as long as they're not rubbing I'll keep em. Again, wonderfully made, even comes with an official card that has inspection details and a signature.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Story

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I have had these boots over 2 years now, they were a little tight at first but broke in within 2 weeks. They are very durable, and comfortable. I spruce them up with saddle soap every month or so. I will probably have to replace the sole in another year. I can't wear them in the summer though, as the heat is just too much in Florida. So I switch off to lighter shoes for a few months. If it wasn't for that I'd wear them every single day.
customer_reviews.author: David Cady

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: I have worn a size13 since 1990 but not in this. As other reviewers found they were to big. For me I had to go down to a 12. The 12 fits great. Seem well made only time will tell. I have and still own for the last 5 years a pair of Chippewa Apaches. I don’t see much difference in quality of leather or stitching. I do like the look of the iron ranger much better.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Thompson

customer_reviews.title: favorite boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots are excellent - It takes a few weeks to break them in but stick with it, its worth it. A small section of the seam where tongue and the upper boot leather meet dug into the top portion of my foot for a couple of weeks but smoothed out quickly. These boots are so comfortable and look great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Go get fitted at a store. They cost the same in store
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews, went to a redwing store and got fitted. Usually wear 11s and and needed up order 9.5 off what I tried on in store and when I got my order the 9.5 fit too small and have unable to contact the seller to make an exchange. The boots themselves are great but the customer service of the seller still has the jury out.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A.

customer_reviews.title: Great boots no issues yet
customer_reviews.text: Awesome boots. Painful for the 1st week of wearing. Used mink paste to soften leather during break in. Wear them most days, the look great, feel good after break in. I wear 11.5 shoes and got the 11.5 boots. They are a littke roomy but i put i insoles so the little but of extra boot helped with that.
customer_reviews.author: Yup

customer_reviews.title: great everyday boot
customer_reviews.text: sturdy, feels great, looks good at the office, tough enough for yard work.
customer_reviews.author: charles_atx

customer_reviews.title: Should be labeled Factory Seconds!
customer_reviews.text: First time purchasing Red Wing boots off Amazon. Priced at almost $100 off retail I figured something had to be off. Once I received my pair I examined closely, and found the welt on the left boot was off leaving a small hole, and found stitch holes around the heel from the factory. Holes are definitely going to allow for moisture damage. These are definitely not factory 1sts. These should be labeled as flawed. Great upper, but flawed welt. 3 stars only due to incorrect advertising.
customer_reviews.author: LF83

customer_reviews.title: Love the Iron Rangers
customer_reviews.text: Previous reviews had me a little nervous about the break in period. I wore thick socks as i always do with boots, and wore them everyday for about a week. I let them and my feet rest on the weekend and back in them on monday. other than a little stiff the rangers broke in nicely and the footbed contoured to my feet. Literally my favorite pair of boots. They look great with just about everything. Tons of compliments everywhere i go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The length is perfect and the sides are snug but not tight
customer_reviews.text: The level of quality on these boots is magnificent! I tried a pair on and went one full size down from my sneaker size. The length is perfect and the sides are snug but not tight. The leather is supple and breaks in much quicker than the 8111 which uses a slightly tougher leather (feel wise, not durability wise) the color is also amazing. The mini lug looks like it wil provide good traction and the sole is rubber instead of the usual Cork Nitrate on the original Iron Ranger 8111. These are boots built to last and I will have no problems working them hard.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P

customer_reviews.title: I went full hipster cowboy and I'm never looking back. This is me now.
customer_reviews.text: "In the world I see you will stalk Elk through the damp canyon surrounding Rockefeller plaza. You will wear leather clothes that will last you the rest of your life" - Chuck Palahniuk. They're more than a fashion boot. They are a forever boot. The only pair of boots you ever have to buy. Or st least that's my review a few weeks out. But I don't see that changing anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work boot
customer_reviews.text: Size down 1/2 to a full size. I wear an 8 in dress shoes/boots, this was a 7.5 for me (a true 7 was too small). If possible, try going in to redwing stores and getting measured.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, questionable distributor.
customer_reviews.text: The boots are great. I returned my pair because the sole was spliting, but I will buy a new pair from an actual Redwing distributor because they have a one year warranty for iron rangers. But this distributor doesn't offer a full refund even when $300 boots start splitting after a month of light use.
customer_reviews.author: Joe P

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of boots.
customer_reviews.text: Male sure to size down 1/2 size although I can see going down a full size if your 'normal' size is a bit big. Great craftsmanship. I didn't have any break in issues at all but that might be because I wear boots or dress shoes 90% of the time. You don't realize how crappy most work boots are until you get a quality pair of red wings.
customer_reviews.author: N718

customer_reviews.title: ... when they were on sale and I couldn't be happier! I'm usually a 11
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots when they were on sale and I couldn't be happier! I'm usually a 11.5-12 in normal shoes but read up on these. I ordered the 11D and they fit perfectly. They were a little snug at first but after an hour or two they already felt broken in enough where they were comfortable. I plan on purchasing some arch support but for the most part these do a good job. My feet have very high arches so this is needed for most shoes. I plan on purchasing more Red Wing boots in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Ry

customer_reviews.title: 5 M (was recommended at least 1/2 size down)
customer_reviews.text: My son usually wears 11 M, we bought 10.5 M (was recommended at least 1/2 size down), it fits with some room for socks. From the first step it was painful to walk in the crease area (where the seam). Breaking in took time and patience, more than 2 weeks past, now he does not complain
customer_reviews.author: GN

customer_reviews.title: Well made boot!  Looks and feels good!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are quality! Went from a 9.5 to a 9 and the fit is just right. About 1 week to break in. And once you add a thin coat of mink oil it darkens the leather to a nice deeper red! Im satisfied with the look, feel & fit of these boots! Worth the investment!
customer_reviews.author: PhillM

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I really like how these feel. I normally wear 10 1/2, but but the 10 and they fit perfectly. I have had them for almost a month and I am still breaking them in, but they really do look great.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: The boots are very well made, very comfortable and look great. The break in is easy a few hours of walk time but you do need some heavy boot socks to protect you from the sharp edges of the leather inside. Personally I stick a piece of duck tape on the back of my foot to protect from blistering but it just takes time to learn how to tie your laces to make them feel firm but comfortable. Easy to clean with just a brush, 30 seconds a day and they keep looking like new even with mud and dust all over them.
customer_reviews.author: AEoe

customer_reviews.title: They fit like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Saw the reviews prior to ordering so I knew to order 1/2 smaller. Im usually a 10.5 and I ordered a 10. They for like a glove. Sizing issues side (which are not really issues as you in advance to order a 1/2 smaller), this is by far the best boot I have ever worn in my life! It is quality through and through. I am now a Red Wings boot fan! I use mine to ride my motorcycles. So if you're looking for a riding boot, look no further. They're a bit expensive, but you work hard, wear the best. You deserve it!
customer_reviews.author: Efrain Vega

customer_reviews.title: Best boots ever.
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. I ordered a size big enough for me to wear wool socks over my regular socks. Then I applied two applications of Huberds Shoe Grease (no animal grease product). Then I just started wearing them. No blisters, no problems, no worries. They're soft and creamy, but they also provide a firm sole that protects my feet from too much bending. I'm a Land Surveyor and need my feet to make a living, and these boots really answered the call.
customer_reviews.author: digibot

customer_reviews.title: Great boots — they run large
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic boots. I can tell they will last forever. As all of the other comments say, go down a size. I am usually a 9, so I bought an 8, and I still think I could have gone another half size smaller. I’m probably a 7.5.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 and found the 9 to be perfect. A full size smaller
customer_reviews.text: The coolest looking boot around. Went to a red wing store for a fitting. I wear a size 10d but i was told the boot should feel snug. Tried a 10 then a 9.5 and found the 9 to be perfect. A full size smaller!! Breakin time virtually non-existsnt. Was comfortable right out of the box. I am in love with these bad boys. The red wing store wanted 320.00,i found them on amazon 190.00 with shipping!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Great boots/high priced
customer_reviews.text: Pricey but really good boots. Sizing tool recommended my normal size but I had to go down a half size for fit. A friend went down a whole size for his pair. Extremely comfortable. Laces seem a little short (too short for a double knot) but they are so stiff they do not come untied. Did I mention they seem pricey.
customer_reviews.author: AEE

customer_reviews.title: Great Motorcycle Boots
customer_reviews.text: My friend recommended these for motorcycling. They are outstanding. I get lots of compliments on them. Yes they are expensive but will probably last you 20 years, it not more.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: Tough break in!
customer_reviews.text: These were without a doubt the least comfortable pair of boots I’d ever owned until I broke them in. And that took a while. But now, they are tolerable to work in. They will never be exactly comfortable, but they are exquisite.
customer_reviews.author: R Patrick Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boots!
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the finest boots I've ever had the pleasure of owning. They weren't kidding about breaking these things in though... BRUTAL. Since the break in period they have only gotten better as the leather and cork sole wear in beautifully. These boots did run a whole size large for me. My Redwing work boots are a 10 and I bought these in a 9. Tight at first but like I said, wore in beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Ike

customer_reviews.title: Iron Rangers
customer_reviews.text: I've owned 3 other pairs of Red Wings dating back to the 80's. I wear a 10 in tennis shoes, and each of my Red Wings are a different size. I highly recommend stopping into a Red Wings store and getting fitted before ordering online. The 10 was too large and the 9 was too tight, but the 9.5 is perfect! These Iron Rangers are top notch in every way. Thick leather, triple stitched and the copper rough and tough leather color is amazing! I look forward to another decade with a pair of Red Wings!!!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Maynard

customer_reviews.title: love these boots
customer_reviews.text: Was not sure what size to order on an iron ranger but further research concluded that I must order a size down and I did .I wore size 10 on running shoes size 9 on iron rangers and they were right.love these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Jezryl Floyd Crisostomo

customer_reviews.title: Fit larger than sneakers. Like a whole size bigger
customer_reviews.text: I knew how these fit when ordering so I was not surprised but if you don’t know... order down a whole size. For reference I wear 15 or 16 in sneakers and a size 14 in these.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B. Dunmore

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Boots!
customer_reviews.text: What boots are supposed to be. They take a little while to break in as to be expected but once they're broke in they are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Ansel Adams

customer_reviews.title: Quality materials and construction
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of Red Wings and I like these even better than the first! Be sure to get your size or even a half size smaller, as they may run a little big but also will stretch as they break in (my experience anyway). Worth the money if you wear boots every day, all day......they last for years.
customer_reviews.author: jody cash

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, very comfortable boots
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, very comfortable boots. Very tempting to make a collection of Redwings. Went through the usual break in period, wasn't too terrible if you wear them on the weekend around the house. Craftsmanship is top notch, they attract a lot of complements.
customer_reviews.author: Tenaki

customer_reviews.title: Extremely well made, take some breaking in
customer_reviews.text: Very well made boot. Extremely stylish. Sizes run large as most have found, I’m normally a 9 and sized down to a 8.5. Definitely need to be broken in, after 1 weeks of a good amount of walking and standing still have some to go. The insoles are unpadded, so you may need to look at adding your own.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy C Diebert

customer_reviews.title: Love those Red Wings
customer_reviews.text: Fit me just right. Have to say it is most expensive pair I ever purchased, but I love them. Broke those first by walking around the house for a few days. My go to boots now. Gino
customer_reviews.author: Gennadi Sedikov

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of Redwing boots and I am in love. I haven't worn boots in a long time. But I decided I would like a pair. After Man years of buy cheap pairs I thought I would maybe an investment. I am pleased with my purchase. I went to the store and tried them on first I went a half size lower. Slowly breaking them in but each time I put them on they feel much more comfortable. Definitely would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: H. Solivan

customer_reviews.title: amazing shoe completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: amazing, they fit a bit large but when i put in some arch support they fit perfectly. they are the most comfortable shoe i have and i wear them every day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are made beautifully in the USA
customer_reviews.text: The boots where on back order at my local Red Wing stores so I found them on Amazon for about $50 less than the store. These are made beautifully in the USA. I have several pair of Allen Edmonds dress shoes and the Red Wings make and fit are identical. Very high quality that should last years.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Worth breaking in - a classic boot
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 11. Got these in 10.5 and the fit was perfect. Definitely requires some breaking-in. About a week to get past initial discomfort. Maybe a month total before they feel great.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Cat

customer_reviews.title: High quality, good looking boot.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered half a size down and they fit like a glove. It took about 30-40 hours of wear to break in the heavy leather, but its worth it. They're comfortable and dress up your look.
customer_reviews.author: JakeDEG

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Leather scratches in the heel area and the mid sole around the heel area missing wood. This boots has two person inspected at Red Wing. I'm not sure how they can miss such defect. Unless these are factory second boots that Amazon selling.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and wearing shoes
customer_reviews.text: Just a tad bigger than true size. Nice and narrow and good arch support, so if you got thin feet they will be great. Size is right in a way but the to box is too long, other than that the quality and craftsmanship are what you expect at the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Greatboot
customer_reviews.text: This is a great boot if you follow Red Wing's sizing guiding (half size down). Took about two weeks to break in good. They are super comfortable and the exact style I enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan Woods

customer_reviews.title: Perfect boot.
customer_reviews.text: Love them. Should have gotten them sooner. Usually wear a 13 1/2-14, never smaller than 13 in any brand. Wife purchased the size 13, they were too big, sent back replaced with 12, perfect fit. Rubbed a little alcohol in certain areas that were stiff. All broke in within 3 weeks. Get compliments, and admiration about them often. Very stylish, and VERY comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed I hadn't bought these years ago! Fantastic boots and something I'd recommend for anyone, for casual wear or work.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Powell

customer_reviews.title: so i ordered 12 US size and they fit perfect! A little room for my toes to move ...
customer_reviews.text: I use between 46 and 47 EU size, so i ordered 12 US size and they fit perfect! A little room for my toes to move and also room enough for a pair of wool socks. Packaging was great and they arrived the day before excpected delivery date. Quality wise i feel like these will last me a lifetime, takes some suffering to walk them in though but that is to be excpected with such thick leather. Definetly worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Gjermund P.

customer_reviews.title: Not just a casual boot!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are sweet! I've worn these boots during all kinds of work. I have worn these boots chainsawing, backcountry trail work and a number of other tasks. Take care of them and they will last!
customer_reviews.author: Greg bishoff

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Age well. Comfortable once worn in (couple days). Buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Bowers

customer_reviews.title: The best boot on the market
customer_reviews.text: There's not much that needs to be said about the Iron Ranger. It's the perfect boot. Please keep in mind that the charcoal rough version is distressed and would need a nice polishing if you want it to be true black. The good thing is that it has a great tread.
customer_reviews.author: George L. Koroneos

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Boots!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful yet tough and ready to work boots. They arrived darker in color due to the oil treatment Red Wing applies when compared to the picture. These boots are made to last. I'm very impressed by the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Mengel

customer_reviews.title: High quality boot; looks and fits as shown but very stiff leather
customer_reviews.text: I've had other Red Wing boots that fit like a glove and were immediately comfortable. These boots look great and are well made but for the price point they should be far more comfortable than they are. Next to no cushion in the sole. I recommend great inner soles and the mink oil to help soften the leather.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: The BEST & Most Beautiful BOOTS!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband, and what a fantastic pair of boots - just gorgeous! He loves them so much. They’re tts, only size up 1/2 a size if you’re planning to wear inserts. (inserts not necessary) This boot will get even better with more wear. The suede will age beautifully. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: Got a half size down. Was able to try some on in person and found that we needed a half size down.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Incredible boots. Helps you look more put together than you are and fit great once broken in. Be sure to treat and waterproof the leather frequently. Welded outsole will be the first thing to wear out but will be easily replaceable. Leather should last a long time. Top notch boots I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great boot! Been a fan of Red Wings for years but these are my first Iron Rangers. Excellent boot.
customer_reviews.author: Michel

customer_reviews.title: Iron rangers
customer_reviews.text: Love the cool and style. There iron rangers, they feel great once broken in.
customer_reviews.author: Erramire

customer_reviews.title: Great boots.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are comfortable and look great. I'm very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W Ball

customer_reviews.title: The perfect boot
customer_reviews.text: Should have listened to the other reviews, they run a size big. I am a size 13 for everything for 20 years. I ordered a 12 and they fit perfect. These boots are well built, comfortable, attractive, and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Beast

customer_reviews.title: Look ever better as they get broken in and scuffed up.
customer_reviews.text: Best boots every, great American product great style and functional
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: happy with the sizing
customer_reviews.text: I only have worn them twice so far, the fit is little stiff, will take a bit of time to break them in. I wear a size 10.5 to 11, went ahead and bought size 11- which fit slightly loose. Overall, happy with the sizing. Love them. Sturdy and stylish.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Chasteen

customer_reviews.title: amazon lockers to the rescue) I love these boots- they are the tits
customer_reviews.text: I had to size down a full size, from 11.5 to 10.5- but, now that I have the right size (after two attempts, amazon lockers to the rescue) I love these boots- they are the tits. Buy them.
customer_reviews.author: kyle hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Like walking on concrete barefoot.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely built shoe..... with no insoles?!?!? It’s like walking on concrete. Once you add insoles the toe room goes from being comfortable to cramped. Probably going to return them. For $300+ I’m not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: fartsalot

customer_reviews.title: Get sized before ordering! Can be perfect right away.
customer_reviews.text: These are top-quality. I highly recommend you get sized in a store before ordering these. If you get the correct fit, they’re comfortable immediately. Can’t wait to wear them a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton A Weis

customer_reviews.title: Heel Concern
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. Just that the heel kinda separates from the boot a little when I ever so slightly pull apart. I'm talking millimeters. Is this because they're hand made? My concern is that they may gradually get worse, and by then wont have a warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Happy camper

product_meta.title: Red Wing Heritage Men's Iron Ranger 6" Vibram Boot
product_meta.description:
A new pair of Red Wing Heritage boots should fit comfortably tight on your foot, with enough room to freely wiggle your toes. Over time, the full grain leather upper, leather footboard and cork midsole mold to your feet, creating an enduring and customized fit over time with each wear. 



Goodyear welt construction . CLEAN - Light Cleaning - Use warm water and a soft bristle brush to remove stuck-on dirt. Then use a clean, dry cloth to wipe away any remaining excess dirt . Deep Cleaning - For heavily soiled areas, use a clean cloth or brush to apply Red Wing Shoes Leather Cleaner. Wipe the cleaner away with a damp cloth and allow the leather to dry. Condition - Proper conditioning helps preserve the finish and life of your footwear. Use Red Wing's All Natural Boot Oil, Mink Oil or All Natural Leather Conditioner. You can apply these conditioners with your fingers, soft cloth or sponge. Below, you will find the recommended conditioner to use with each of our Red Wing leathers. PROTECT - Add extra protection to preserve your footwear. Red Wing Leather Protector provides an invisible shield from water, dirt, oil and mud. Leather is made up of Amber Harness Leather. Insole is made up of Leather.
feature_bullets: The product is natural leather and its easy for scuffs to happen but they rub out.This can be removed by a soft dry cloth and lightly buffed out the scuffs.
Fit Tip-1/2 size smaller than their normal size. Hardware- Nickel Eyelets and Hooks. Outsole-Nitrile Cork.Steel shank
Features a bump toe for more room up-front. 48 inch black or brown taslan lace
